labels.analysis: The MCP Server provides tools to access, retrieve, and process Wikipedia content in real-time. Its core functionality revolves around searching for articles, retrieving full content or summaries, and identifying related topics. This enhances AI assistants by providing accurate, reliable, and up-to-date factual information, making it ideal for grounded and reliable responses.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Web Search & Research" is chosen because the server's primary functionality is to provide access to Wikipedia's vast knowledge base, which is a core aspect of information retrieval and research. "Content Creation" is added as a secondary label because the server facilitates the generation of informed, fact-checked content. A custom label is not needed as the predefined labels adequately cover the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: Wikipedia Information Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Rudra-ravi/wikipedia-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide real-time access to Wikipedia content to enhance AI assistants with accurate and up-to-date factual information. Enable LLMs to search articles, retrieve full content, summaries, sections, links, and related topics from Wikipedia in multiple languages. Facilitate grounded and reliable responses by integrating Wikipedia data seamlessly.

tools.name: search_wikipedia
tools.description: Deploy Server Wikipedia Information Server @Rudra-ravi/wikipedia-mcp Try in Playground search_wikipedia

tools.name: get_article
tools.description: Get the full content of a Wikipedia article.

tools.name: get_summary
tools.description: Get a summary of a Wikipedia article.

tools.name: get_related_topics
tools.description: Get topics related to a Wikipedia article based on links and categories.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Rudra-ravi/wikipedia-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
